speaker: Skyline
text: A silver dirigible floats across the skyline.  _ACT ONE  Scene One - KACL Frasier is wrapping up his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: I would like to close the show today with a truly inspirational tale.  One year ago, a very successful friend of mine was struck by tragedy.  Prognosis: not good.  Hope: slim.  But armed with only fortitude, this friend of mine fought back. I'm talking, of course, about the reopening of Seattle's finest restaurant, Chez Henri!  Just goes to show you that a four-alarm fire is no match for five-star courage.  This is Frasier Crane saying good day, and good mental health.

speaker: Roz
text: See you still don't have a table for opening night.

speaker: Frasier
text: And it's killing me!

speaker: Kenny
text: OK everyone, it's show time.  The new station owner's on his way down.  So look alive! [_claps his hands_]  Watch what you say, watch what you don't say.  Don't say too much, don't say too little. [_wipes his brow and neck_] What the hell's this thermostat set at, anyway?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, Kenny, calm down!  We've done the "new owner" drill

speaker: Roz
text: the glad-handing sycophant, or our salute to teamwork?

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, yeah, very funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, Kenny, you know how these people come and go.  They introduce themselves, they shake your hand, tell us they're big fans, and then they're gone.  Nothing ever changes.  So, you know, don't worry about it.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, that's easy for you to say, you've got a contract! _Todd Peterson, KACL's new owner, comes in the booth with a candy bar in one hand.  To Frasier and Roz's surprise, Todd is a casually dressed redheaded man in his twenties._

speaker: Todd
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh hello, sir! [_sees the candy bar_] Ah, Clark-Bar! [_gives him a thumbs up_] Excellent choice, sir!

speaker: Frasier
text: You must be the new owner.  Hi, I'm Frasier Crane and this is my producer Roz Doyle.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Todd
text: [_shaking hands_] Todd Peterson.

speaker: Kenny
text: Mr. Peterson's one of the brightest stars of Silicon Valley.

speaker: Todd
text: Thank you, Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: And he's one of the youngest members of the Fortune 500.

speaker: Todd
text: Please, you're embarrassing me.

speaker: Kenny
text: And he's a big fan of your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now you're embarrassing me! [_chuckles_] Go on.

speaker: Todd
text: It's true, I've been listening since college.  I love the theme weeks.  But I was really into "Follow-up Fridays," when you had previous callers call in, let you know how they're doing.  Why'd you stop doing that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gravely_] Oh well, it wasn't _my_ idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Todd, uh, seeing as how you are such a big fan, perhaps I could bend your ear sometime about a few ideas I have for the show.

speaker: Todd
text: Great!  I'd love to hear them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, how about later today perhaps, over cocktails at my place?

speaker: Todd
text: That would be cool!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, cool indeed!

speaker: Todd
text: Later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, and may I say it's truly an honor to be serving under your leadership!  This is a great day for KACL, indeed for radio itself!

speaker: Roz
text: I see you decided to skip "glad-handing sycophant" and go straight for "boot-licking kiss-ass."  _Frasier nods contentedly.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Martin straddles a chair while Daphne massages him._

speaker: Martin
text: [_groans with pleasure_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Is that too much?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, it feels great, Daph.  Lot of elbow grease there today.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose I'm a bit wound up.  Niles is out with Mel.  I don't trust that woman.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on.  He's not with her because he wants to be. He's just gonna give her what she wants so she'll give him the divorce.  He's crazy about you, you know that.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_smiles_] I know.  And I'm crazy about him.

speaker: Martin
text: Still, Niles has been gone for a long time.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's open!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello!

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry I'm late, Mel picked a restaurant on the other side of town.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm getting so tired of that woman's antics.

speaker: Martin
text: Antics, that's what they are! _She digs in even harder, he groans.  She stops as Niles hangs up his coat._

speaker: Daphne
text: This whole charade, making you pretend you're a happy couple, it's so unfair!

speaker: Martin
text: Criminal!  She won't even allow you to be seen in public together! [_she does nothing_] Did you hear that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Give it up, old man, the massage is over.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I know it's difficult.  But once she gives me that divorce, we can go anywhere we want.  Paris... Florence... Rio...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_seductive_] How about my room to fold laundry?

speaker: Niles
text: I hear it's lovely this time of year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh, Dad, listen, you know, I've got some company coming over.  So if you don't mind, uh-

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hot date, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Dad, the new station owner's coming by to hear some ideas I have about my show.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's a woman at least, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever gets you out of the room faster, Dad.  _The doorbell rings.  As Martin and Eddie scurry out of the room, Frasier opens the door to Todd._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Todd, come on in.

speaker: Todd
text: Hi, Frasier. [_comes in_] Whoa!  Sweet view!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, thank you.  That's the Space Needle there, of course, and Elliot Bay, and actually on a clear day you can see Mt. Rinnear.

speaker: Todd
text: Epic! [_looks down through the telescope_] Is that a Pizza Hut?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we did start a petition-

speaker: Todd
text: Well, it must have worked.  That _is_ a Pizza Hut! [_looks around_] You've got a great place here, Fras!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Todd
text: [_picks up an African sculpture_] I like this.  What, did your kid carve it in camp?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, that's a fertility god from Central Africa, it's quite rare. [_Todd hands it back with a naughty chuckle_] Thank you.  Say, uh, Todd, can I interest you in a sherry?

speaker: Todd
text: Nah.  It'd be wasted on me.  I don't know the first thing about that stuff.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, in the great scheme of things, it's not really very important.

speaker: Todd
text: It kind of is.  I mean, ever since my search engine went public, people have been inviting me to fundraisers and banquets. [_picks up a sculpture from the coffee table and tries to pry it open_] They expect me to know all sorts of things about art and music, wine - I don't know jack, it's embarrassing.  _Having no luck, he tries to break it open on the table.  Frasier rushes forward and snatches it._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure you're exaggerating.

speaker: Todd
text: No, I spent my whole life in front of a computer.  I don't know Beethoven from... Beethoven's the only one I know!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's never too late to learn.  I'd be glad to give you some pointers.

speaker: Todd
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be delighted!  I will play Virgil to your Dante. [_off Todd's blank look_] In a few weeks, I can guarantee you, you will find that delightfully droll.  Say, how about that sherry?

speaker: Todd
text: Oh, yeah!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then - which you should know, is a fortified wine.

speaker: Todd
text: Wow, Frasier, you really know your stuff!  Look at these great paintings, cool furniture, African sex toys!  This is how I should be living... how much you want for the place?

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Todd
text: I could use a place in town.  Name your price.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, Todd.  My humble home is not for sale.  But, you know, as luck would have it, there happens to be a unit available directly below mine.

speaker: Todd
text: This'll be great, we'll be neighbors!  You can teach me to have as much taste and style as you.  And I can do everything possible to make you the biggest star on radio.  _For a moment Frasier just stands there with a rapt, transported look on his face._

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew one day you'd come.  _He hands Todd a sherry, and they clink glasses.  FADE TO:_  **IT'S ABOUT A CZECHOSLOVAKIAN BAGPIPER**  _Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa Niles is seated at a table.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, mind if I join you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, uh, just for a little while, I'm meeting Mel here. Oh, which reminds me- [_slips on his wedding ring_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, I am sorry to hear that.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, actually this is wonderful news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: She called.  She said my days of playing the devoted husband are coming to an end.  Frasier, I think my wife is finally going to dump me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and they said it would last. [_they laugh_]  You know, actually, I'm celebrating an event myself.  You see, I've just become... a mentor.

speaker: Niles
text: Good for you, Frasier, helping the unprivileged.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, he's a billionaire.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, the forgotten minority.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's the new station owner.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, for heaven's sake, you're mentoring your boss?  How did you flatter your way into that job?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I-I didn't.  The boy practically begged me. I mean, he got rich overnight, and he's hardly had time to shed his fraternity house ways.

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds like an enormous project.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I am a teacher at heart, after all.  You know, last night I took him to Le Cafe du Peridee, to practice sending back wine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me. [_answers_] Hello?  Ah, Todd, yes, we were just talking about you!  Yes, no.  No, no, no, no, no, never French cuffs with a button-down collar. [_Niles chuckles_] He's being fitted by Haviare.

speaker: Niles
text: Very nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] The long collar, yes.  What sort of stripes? Don't move, I'll be right down there! [_hangs up_] I have to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Mel.

speaker: Mel
text: [_Arctic smile_] Frasier.  You're looking...

speaker: Frasier
text: And you, we must do this again.

speaker: Mel
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, Mel, hello.  Well, I, uh, I gather things are coming to an end.  Thank you for being true to your word.

speaker: Mel
text: No, thank you for doing such a good job in... Phase One.

speaker: Niles
text: [_fazed_] "Phase One?"

speaker: Mel
text: Well Niles, it occurred to me that if we end things now, people will wonder why - when, you know, we've been so happy. So I've decided that it's not so much that I'm going to leave you, as you're going to drive me away.

speaker: Niles
text: How?

speaker: Mel
text: Through a series of staged events, in which you will thoroughly humiliate yourself by playing the part of a complete ass! [_gives him a ticket envelope_] For instance, this weekend we're going to the opera-

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, I see, I see.  So you want me to... hog the opera glasses and remain seated during the ovation, something of that nature? Well, I-I suppose I could manage it.

speaker: Mel
text: No, not quite.  At the intermission, invariably some board member will come over to say hello, and I want you to fly into a jealous rage and throw a drink at him!

speaker: Niles
text: That is unthinkable!  I have a reputation in this town, [_throws the envelope down_] and nothing will make me behave that way!

speaker: Mel
text: Well, looks like we're going to be married for a long time. _Niles is trapped, and she knows it.  He takes the envelope and checks the name._

speaker: Niles
text: [_steely_] I'll see you at _Schwander de Dudelsach Feiffen.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Apartment - Night Frasier opens the door to Roz and Kenny, both formally dressed.  Kenny is sweating again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you two doing here?  Todd's apartment's one floor down.

speaker: Roz
text: We know.  But why walk into his housewarming alone when we can go in with his idol?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, I'm hardly his idol.  I'm a paragon at best. _Reset to: Hallway He leads them into the hallway, carrying the African fertility sculpture wrapped in a little bow._

speaker: Kenny
text: What's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just a little something that Todd admired when he was over.

speaker: Kenny
text: I didn't know we were supposed to bring gifts!  Oh, now I'm screwed! [_they step onto the elevator_] I am so fired.  God, why did I give my wife the go-ahead for that above-ground pool?

speaker: Roz
text: Better calm down, Kenny.  I gave you my last pair of dress shields.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now remember that Todd has had people working round the clock, transforming his apartment into his vision of style and taste. And no matter how primitive we may think it is, it's best to be kind.  We don't want to stifle his budding creativity.

speaker: Roz
text: You also don't want to stifle that fat syndication deal he's putting together for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, you are so cynical!  That's why you could never be a mentor.

speaker: Todd
text: Hey guys, come on in! _They come in - and gape.  Though a sustained shot of the room is not shown, the effect is clear: Todd has duplicated Frasier's apartment exactly, the same furniture/art/appliances in the exactly corresponding positions.  The sole difference (that I was able to catch) is that in place of Martin's armchair stands a slightly newer, cleaner easy chair.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **BOXERS OR BRIEFS? IT'S DRIVING HIM CRAZY**  _Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa. Niles is at a table.  Frasier comes in and joins him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  Say, if memory serves, you went to the opera with Mel last night.  So, did you cause a public spectacle? I didn't read anything in the society pages.

speaker: Niles
text: No, well, it didn't go exactly as I expected.  At intermission I got my drink and waited for someone to approach Mel.  And finally someone did - uh, Founder's Circle stalwart Ace Linneur.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: I coiled, panther-like, ready to fling my drink on his shirtfront, when I noticed he was wearing that wool crepe hand-tailored tuxedo of his.  Well, [_laughs nervously_] I couldn't raise my hand against such a magnificent garment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that tux is a blend and you know it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, of course I know it!  Frasier, I-I just couldn't do it!  That kind of loutish behavior, it's just not in my nature.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, Niles, that goes without saying.  Just remember for whom you're doing all this.

speaker: Niles
text: Believe me, Daphne is the only thing that is keeping me going through all of this.  Tonight I'm supposed to meet Mel for dinner at Chez Henri, and make an ass of myself in front of her society friends.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord - Chez Henri.  Their menu is just the culinary minefield to test Todd's mettle.  Hmm...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, your protege.  How's that coming along?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, things have taken a bit of an odd turn.  You see, yesterday I went to his housewarming party.  As it turns out, to my surprise, he has duplicated my apartment exactly.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Only thing missing is an old man and a little dog.  I was beside myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, of course you were!  I assume you read him the riot act.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he is my boss.  He has big plans for my show.  Do I really want to jeopardize that?

speaker: Frasier
text: There's Todd now.  Uh, Todd?  Over here!  I'd like you to meet my brother, Niles Crane. [_they ad-lib hellos and shake hands_] Niles, this is Todd Peterson.  _As they stand next to each other, Niles realizes Frasier and Todd's suits are exactly identical._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello - oh, and-and may I say, what a... what a lovely outfit. Hope you got the volume discount.

speaker: Todd
text: Guess who's officially hooked on classics!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, good for you, good for you.  Now Todd, I-I'd like to talk to you about your apartment.

speaker: Todd
text: You don't like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, I do like it.  I've liked it for eight years.

speaker: Todd
text: So what's the problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was hoping that my influence would help you to find your own style, not that you would simply duplicate mine.

speaker: Todd
text: What am I doing?  I'm in way over my head here, let's admit it, with all this culture stuff.  I should just stick to what I know, computers - I'm a computer guy!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Todd, you know, perhaps we just took on a bit too much too soon.

speaker: Todd
text: I need to move back to San Jose, sell the apartment, sell the radio station-

speaker: Frasier
text: Steady at the wheel, Todd.  Now listen, uh, all we're really talking about is a couple of couches and some coffee tables.

speaker: Todd
text: But you said we shouldn't have the same apartment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and we shouldn't... Perhaps I'm being too hasty about which of us should be doing the changing.  Perhaps I'm holding on too tight to my possessions!  Decor is, after all, a fluid art!

speaker: Todd
text: [_reaches for a pen_] Should I be writing this down?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Todd.  Listen, Todd, I want you to keep the apartment the way it is.  After all, it's a look that has served me well, but it's time that I move on.

speaker: Todd
text: Thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you, Todd.

speaker: Todd
text: Hey, you want to come see my new car?  I have a feeling you're gonna like it!

speaker: Frasier
text: I have a feeling I will. _FADE TO:  Scene Six - Chez Henri Niles and Mel, dressed formally, stand at a distance from their table, at which two other couples (Andrew/Margaret & Chip/Lucy) are seated. _

speaker: Mel
text: Niles, you have been behaving like a perfect gentlemen all night, now cut it out!  And do something offensive!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know at which table you've been sitting!  Did you not just see me unapologetically take the last roll?

speaker: Mel
text: I need more than that, and you know it.  Now, my friends are giving you plenty to work with - Andrew has been drinking like a fish, and Margaret is wearing that revolting dress, again.

speaker: Niles
text: Meow!  I'm glad you're on my side. [_off her look_] I can do this.

speaker: Mel
text: Sorry, everyone!

speaker: Margaret
text: Oh, you newlyweds!  Just can't be apart for one second!

speaker: Mel
text: Oh, the bill!  Oh, but we're not finished.  Uh, we still have wine, would anyone like a refill?

speaker: Andrew
text: [_tidges himself up_] I'm a little dry.

speaker: Niles
text: Dry?  I know that's not your liver speaking!

speaker: Mel
text: Niles!  We just discussed you were not going to bring that up!

speaker: Niles
text: Well I did, so there. [_she kicks him under the table_] And I'll say it again! [_to Andrew_] You're probably seeing two of me, so you might as well hear me twice!  You sir, are a complete drunk!

speaker: Andrew
text: Niles, how could you...

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh-

speaker: Andrew
text: How could you know?  I thought I was hiding it so well. I have a problem, it's time I face it.

speaker: Chip
text: I've been meaning to say something, but I didn't have the courage.

speaker: Lucy
text: Not like Niles.  You're a good person.

speaker: Andrew
text: I'm getting help first thing tomorrow.  I'm so sorry, baby.

speaker: Margaret
text: [_takes Andrew's arm; to Niles_] Thank you for giving me my husband back.  Mel, darling, you married an angel.

speaker: Mel
text: [_choking on the words_] Don't I know it. _Niles, to his credit, looks as disappointed as Mel.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Apartment Martin comes into the living room and sees Frasier dressed in casual clothes.  The Apartment is now completely redecorated with black, boxy furniture, a weird angular couch - the only thing unchanged is Martin's Armchair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Dad.  What do you think of the new look?

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, nice stuff.  You really tied the flow to the motif.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for trying.  Well, shall we give it a test run?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little music... _He turns on the stereo.  "Classical Gas," a guitar anthem from the 1970's, plays.  (If you haven't heard it before, all you really need to know is that it's not Frasier)  Martin settles into his armchair with the newspaper.  Frasier lounges in one of his new chairs, trying to get comfortable.  After a moment, he gets up and lies across his couch, trying to fit his body to the shape of it.  RUN: A series of dissolves where Frasier tries to capture the right look: - the furniture is all white - the furniture is a mix of black and white - the furniture is all red - the final one: the apartment resembles a British lord's bungalow in Africa: bamboo furniture, tall potted ferns, and a zebra skin draped over the couch.  Frasier tries to get comfortable by sitting on the couch and draping the skin over his head.  Scene Eight - Apartment DISSOLVE TO: a close up of Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad? _The Apartment is now totally bare, except for Martin, his Chair, and his little drink table, none of which have moved throughout the preceding changes._

speaker: Martin
text: [_not looking up_] Looks great, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's nothing here.

speaker: Martin
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: I give up.  I've tried a million combinations.  I even had early Byzantine mingling with mid-century Danish!

speaker: Martin
text: Will they ever get along?

speaker: Frasier
text: The only furniture that looks good in my apartment is my own!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I could have told you that three loveseats ago!  So what are you waiting for?  Go bring it back!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm glad I went to three different stores to find your organic furniture polish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Daphne, chin up.  You can always use it to polish the floors.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes.  When God closes a door he opens a window.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, even if I do get my furniture back, it doesn't solve anything!  There's still someone downstairs with my apartment!

speaker: Martin
text: That's not your apartment, this is your apartment!  And if every stooge in the building rips you off, it doesn't take anything away from you because you were the original!

speaker: Frasier
text: I am, aren't I?  You know I did, after all, create that look, and that should be gratification enough.

speaker: Martin
text: Good for you, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean, besides, you know, Todd's hardly ever here.  He doesn't have very many friends.  You know, in fact, the only person who's ever gonna see that apartment is probably the Pizza Hut delivery boy! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah Todd, come on in.

speaker: Todd
text: Hey, Fras, I just need to know the name of the chick who made our couch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right - it's a reproduction of the one Coco Chanel had in her Paris _atelier_. [_Todd exhales_] But why?

speaker: Todd
text: The writer from _"Architectural Digest"_ wants to know.

speaker: Frasier
text: _"Architectural Digest?"_

speaker: Todd
text: They're doing a huge cover story on my apartment!  And I have you to thank for it, buddy!  Well, I got to go, the photographer's waiting.  Later. _Todd leaves, closing the door.  Frasier slowly turns around, apoplectic -- mouth gaping, body convulsing, unable to speak. Martin looks at him worriedly.  Frasier rushes around the Apartment._

speaker: Frasier
text: I need to sit down! _Martin gets up and motions Frasier to the Armchair.  Frasier backs away from it in horror, looking around in desperation.  Finally he goes into the powder room, sits on the toilet, and buries his head in his hands._
